page.title: 04FARMING
page.content:
Much of the land is held in areas of less than 10 acres. calves are reared, land grazed by sheep or the grass mown for hay, but these enterprises do not provide the main income of the household. On the small farms (less than 100 acres) farming is combined with other business e.g. building. Three properties of small area are cultivated as nurseries, but although very many other properties have an acre or so of land they rarely use it for profit. Arable crops are confined to the few larger farms, one of which is almost entirely arable.
